result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Weiss

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Attorney Newton
Filed by DA Office - statement of C.A.A.

9:20 AM Defendant James D Weiss in court.  Attorney John Andrew Newton in court for James D Weiss.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by Attorney Newton. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2 & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Count 1 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant on count 2 to serve 180 days in jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent with count 3. $543.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Count 3; 90 days jail, with Huber, concurrent with count 2. $343.00 costs. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Jail start 10/1/22 at 7:00 PM. 4 days sentence credit. 9:37 PM
Copy of discovery letter to Attorney Newton from ADA Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff
Return date on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Newton re: additional discovery material
filed by Atty Newton requesting reset for the 7/29/22 return date

No contact with C.A.A., or their children, residence, work place, and vehicle. No contact with 517 E. Cook St. #11 until Thursday at Noon.
